result.execSummary:
The defendant William S Buss was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Obtain GED, HSED or it's equivalent, at agent's discretion.  Seek and maintain employment, not to terminate without agent's prior approval.
Defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.
Defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  

Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Dominguez.  Defendant plead no contest to Count 1.  Counts 2, 3 and 4. dismissed, but read in for restitution purposes.    Elements reviewed by the court with the defendant.  Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights with the defendant.  Defendant understood.   Defense stipulated to a factual basis for the charge.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty of Count 1.  Joint recommendation for 1 year probation.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed. Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.   Seek and maintain employment. Defendant elected to exercise his right to allocution. 

Court ordered: sentence withheld, 1 year probation.   The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.   AODA, and recommendations.   Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed. Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.   Seek and maintain employment, not to terminate without agent's prior approval. Obtain GED, HSED or it's equivalent, at agent's discretion.  CC & DNA submission requirement.  RETURN BOND TO POSTER.

William called @ about 8:45 a.m. to say he ran out of gas and is off in the way side just before exit 16; trf call to judges office; told him to call his insurance co. or else he can call back & we can give him facilities that have gas that may be able to help him.
